comment._content: This was replaced in the 1960s by 130 East 18th Street [http://www.flickr.com/photos/leesemel/3114256502/]

comment.author: 46317563@N04
comment._content: The Stuyvesant was built in 1869 (Richard Morris Hunt) and was west of Third Avenue.

comment.author: 64099524@N00
comment._content: The current oldest apartment in New York is directly behind 130 East 18th Street, at 129 East 17th Street: www.nytimes.com/1990/07/08/realestate/streetscapes-129-ea...

comment.author: 50410426@N07
comment._content: I lived in 142 East 18th from 1939 until the 1950's when it was torn down. Each apartment had 7 rooms and 4 working fireplaces where we burned cannel coal in the winter. The owners selected tenants as creative artists. The building was full of writers, painters, sculptors. Both my parents were artists. The Asiatic curator for he Metropolitan Museum lived on the top floor and his relative, the queen of The Netherlands visited when I was there. At one time a scene from the film "The Kiss of Death" where Richard Widmark throws an old lady in a wheel chair down the stairs was shot there.   Louise Bourgeois, the sculptor, lived there at the same time I did. There was an old doorman named John who kept an eye on things like bicycles in a room adjoining the entrance. The poet Ann Lauterbach lived there as a child - she was 12 years old when I knew her. Her father, Richard Lauterbach, was an editor for Life magazine and subsequently worked with the newspaper PM. It was a great place.

comment.author: 64099524@N00
comment._content: @JanSand, looks like I now live in the same spot you did.  Unfortunately, I'm sure we don't have any artists living in 7-room apartments, as the 3-bedrooms go for a couple million dollars.  We sill have Pete's Tavern and the brownstones across the street, was it the same when you lived here?  Do you have any pictures of this neighborhood from then?

comment.author: 50410426@N07
comment._content: I now live in a suburb of Helsinki, Finland called Maunula. I have one medium sized room with all my stuff, a small kitchen and a bathroom. It's enough in my old age. I am now 84.I have a blog at open.salon.com/blog/jsand My next post there will have some information about that house. My father paid $75 per month rent.

comment.author: 50410426@N07
comment._content: If you want to get in direct contact with me my e-mail is jiisand@gmail.com

comment.author: 48275745@N06
comment._content: @JanSand - loved your description on when you lived at 142 East 18th street. I presently live on 18th Street between 1st and 2nd avenue. I was doing some research about Stuyvesant Park for our "Open Air Gallery Event" we are hosting in October. I belong to the Stuyvesant Square Community Alliance where we focus on bringing awareness to the parks and a sense of community. Thank you for sharing. :) Laura

comment.author: 49725739@N00
comment._content: My mother grew up in that building, her parents were painters...
